definition: to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise

sentences.english: They rushed clamorously into the presence of the lioness, and demanded of her the settlement of the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 他们吵吵嚷嚷，跑到母狮面前，请她解决争端。

sentences.english: The noisy fellow was thrown out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 这个吵吵嚷嚷的家伙被人从大厅里撵出去了。

sentences.english: A bitter controversy about the siting of the airport is rumbling in the designing institute.
sentences.chinese: 设计院里正吵吵嚷嚷着对机场选址问题作激烈争论。

sentences.english: Those children are always quarreling among themselves .
sentences.chinese: 那些小孩子互相间老是吵吵闹闹。

sentences.english: He listens to courtier quarrels a voice and argue noisily, like a boiler of gruel of ebullition.
sentences.chinese: 他听着朝臣争执声，吵吵闹闹，如一锅沸腾的粥。

sentences.english: What are they making such a hoo-ha about?
sentences.chinese: 他们这样吵吵闹闹是怎么回事？

sentences.english: I've also missed the clamorous days with my friends.
sentences.chinese: 好怀念朋友们在我身边吵吵闹闹的日子。

sentences.english: The ex-mayor, by comparison didn't think there was anything funny about noise.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，前市长并不认为吵吵闹闹有什么好玩的。

sentences.english: Yes, as long as I could bear their noise;
sentences.chinese: 是的，假使我能忍受他们吵吵闹闹的话。

sentences.english: They burst boisterously into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他们吵吵嚷嚷地闯入房间。

sentences.english: The pupils are racketing about in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 学生们在教室里吵吵闹闹。

sentences.english: I can't stand those mouthy brats.
sentences.chinese: 我无法忍受那些吵吵闹闹的小孩。

sentences.english: They are clamorous for better pay.
sentences.chinese: 他们吵吵嚷嚷要求增加工资。

definition: to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to make a lot of noise/to be disorderly
